feed.subtitle: ABAP Development Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: How To CheckIn URL Attachment with API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV CreateUrlAsAttachment
entry.content:
Hi All, 

With this API I can successfully create URL Original in the Document Info Record, However that created URL Original is not checked In, How to do CheckIn with this API ? I dont see any parameter in this API to do CheckIn ? Is there any Other API which could do CheckIn as well ?

Enclosed the Successful Call with which the URL Original was created.

https://server:44300/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/CreateUrlAsAttachment?BusinessObjectTypeName='DRAW'&LinkedSAPObjectKey='ART000000000000005000000002701000'&Url='https://test.com'&UrlDescription='Link'&MIMEType='text/url'

As it can be seen in the Screenshot below, the Original was not locked, which means it is not checked In. 

Any Hint, how can i achieve this Lock along with the creation of the URL attachment.

 

 

BR,

Ketan

entry.title: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)
entry.content:
Preparing for a SAP ABAP or S/4HANA interview can feel overwhelming. You spend hours revising concepts, yet when the interview starts, the real challenge is remembering which questions are most commonly asked and how to answer them with clarity.

To help you overcome this, I‚Äôve compiled the Top 25 SAP ABAP and S/4HANA Interview Questions for 2025‚Äîbased on real-world interview experiences and what hiring managers actually look for.

This post curates the most common SAP ABAP & S/4HANA interview questions for 2025‚Äîspanning DDIC, ALV, BDC, CDS, AMDP, Open vs Native SQL, ABAP on HANA, Web Dynpro and more. For clear, step-by-step answers, watch the full breakdown here:
üëâ Video: Top 25 SAP S/4HANA & ABAP Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üìå Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions (2025)

  1. What is SAP ABAP?
  2. What is the ABAP Data Dictionary (DDIC)?
  3. Difference between transparent tables and pooled/cluster tables
  4. What are SmartForms and their benefits over SAP Scripts?
  5. Difference between function modules and BAPIs
  6. What is BDC (Batch Data Communication)? Methods: recording, session, call transaction
  7. What are modularization techniques in ABAP?
  8. Difference between Classical Reports, Interactive Reports, and ALV Reports
  9. What are field symbols and how are they used?
  10. How do you define and use internal tables?
  11. What are the basic data types in ABAP?
  12. What is ABAP Objects (OOP in ABAP)?
  13. Explain inheritance and polymorphism in ABAP Objects
  14. What is a Lock Object? How is locking handled in ABAP?
  15. Open SQL vs Native SQL ‚Äì differences and use cases
  16. What are RICEFW objects in SAP projects?
  17. Explain CALL TRANSACTION and its use cases
  18. What are CDS Views and their significance in S/4HANA?
  19. What is AMDP (ABAP Managed Database Procedure) and why is it used?
  20. Debugging in ABAP ‚Äì breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps
  21. What is Web Dynpro for ABAP?
  22. CDS vs AMDP vs Traditional Reports ‚Äì when to use which?
  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?
  24. What tools and T-codes are essential for ABAP development?
  25. What are type groups and their purpose in ABAP?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. Interviewers are no longer just testing textbook knowledge‚Äîthey want to see if you can connect concepts to real project scenarios. These 25 questions cover exactly that mix of fundamentals + modern ABAP practices.

üìΩÔ∏è For in-depth answers, examples, and explanations, check out the full video:
üëâ Top 25 SAP ABAP & S/4HANA Interview Questions and Answers (2025)

üí° Tip: Don‚Äôt just memorize these questions‚Äîtry to explain them in your own words, link them to project experience, and always be ready with a short example. That‚Äôs what makes you stand out in interviews.

Thanks
Anil

entry.title: Can't create Transport Request for my new ABAP Cloud Package
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently going through Learning the Basics of ABAP Programming on SAP BTP and I am attempting to create a package as shown in the lesson Running Software Structure and Logistics in order to then assign a Transport Request to it.

The third step in the "Create ABAP Package" window is different on my Eclipse than on the Eclipse from the demo, and when I click next the following problem arises:

"A top level package already exists for the software component ZLOCAL (PAK684)"

as shown in the following screenshot

IF in the first step of this window I select "ZLOCAL" as super package (just for the sake of trying) I do get to the menu for the new transport layer creation, but it is disabled as shown below.

Thanks in advance,

ivo

entry.title: Calling bound RAP action from CAP / Node.js backend with OData V4
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am trying to call a bound RAP Action from a CAP backend and am running into some issues with the namespace that comes with the service beeing OData V4. 

As described in the CAP documentation I tried the following syntax:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: 'final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

 This returns an error because the ressource can't be found. As to be expected, because OData V4 action calls need the namespace added as a prefix. The rest of the call looks totally fine.

If I adapt the code to include the namespace, it looks like this:

let response = await external_service.send({
   event: '<MyNamespace>.final_approval',
   entity: '<MyEntity>',
   data: { 
      username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
      reason: '' },
   params: [{
      ID: id
   }]
})

The request fails again - with error:  URI has a slash as last character
This is the result from the the call URI not beeing build correctly. It looks something like this:

/sap/opu/odata4/.../<MyEntity/

The ID is not passed to the URI anymore, so the intance is not called, as well as the actual action call that is missing completely.

Did anyone experience the same behavior?

Note: I got it to work by building the request myself:

let response = await external_service.send({
   method: 'POST',
   headers: {
      "If-Match": '*'
   },
   path: `/<MyEntity>(${id})/<MyNamespace>.final_approval`,
   data: { 
       username: req.user.id.toLowerCase(), 
       reason: ''
   },
})

Thanks in advance!
Best regards,
Lukas

entry.title: BAdI/User Exit for Billing Document Creation (VF01 ‚Äì Type RE) to Trigger Workflow
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a requirement where a workflow approval process needs to be triggered whenever a Billing Document of type RE is created using transaction VF01.

üîπRequirement:

  • When a billing document of type RE is created and saved in VF01,

  • A workflow event should be raised so that the document goes for approval before completion.

üîπMy Question:

  • Which BAdI or User Exit is best suited to capture the save of a billing document in VF01 for this purpose?

  • The requirement is to identify the correct enhancement point where I can place logic to trigger the workflow event.

Any guidance or best practice recommendation would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Kiran Kumar

entry.title: Network Assignment on VBEP-AUFNR gets deleted due to Credit Block (FSCM)
entry.content:
Dear All, 

We have implemented FSCM Credit Management on ECC and face the issue that when a Sales Order goes on a credit block, no Network Plan gets created. In addition, we have the issue when a network plan was assigned to the sales order and the credit check is executed and failed (e.g., due to not enough credit limit), the existing network plan assignment (VBEP-AUFNR) gets deleted. 

We thought that this had something to do with the confirmed quantities, but were not able to confirm this assumption so far. 

Does somebody have an idea what could be checked?  Or does somebody know the behaviour that the AUFNR gets deleted due to a credit block?

Thank you very much for your support!

Appreciate the feedback.

Thank you.

Geoff

entry.title: RPCNETN0 page down button not working in subscreen
entry.content:
I need to create a program where I do a payroll simulation using program RPCNETN0.

After entering the employee number and using the Read Pers. Data button I need to enter additional payment wagetypes in the Payment TAB. I will be doing using this via BDCDATA. Since I don't know with how many records this subscreen will be filled after reading the data for the employee I want to to Use PAge down so afterwards I can use the first available row to add the extra data.

When I use the Page Down button in the subscreen however it does nothing, clicking on the scrollbar however does work (usually only if this is the first action I perform after going to the subscreen). I tried recording this using SHDB, but clicking on the scrollbar isn't something that is recorded.

Does anybody have experience with this kind of thing and maybe have a work-around for it.

entry.title: Difference between TYPE and LIKE in ABAP ‚Äì When to use what?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am a bit confused about the usage of  TYPE and LIKE in ABAP. I know both are used for declaring data objects, but I am not very clear on when exactly I should prefer TYPE and when LIKE.

Both seem to work, but I believe there are differences in behavior and best practices.

Can someone please explain in which scenarios we should go for TYPE and in which scenarios LIKE is the better choice? Some practical examples would be really helpful.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an internal table
entry.content:
Hello there.

Is there any method I can use to load files to internal tables in ABAP2XLSX ?

I mean, a method like FM ALSM_EXCEL_TO_INTERNAL_TABLE, that returns a table with fields: row, col and value.
But with an extra field:  worksheet_number, row, col and value.

I've read some post like this with specific solutions for a concrete internal table, but I would like to have a more generic method for any internal table.

https://adityaaufar.medium.com/most-common-use-case-of-abap2xlsx-excel-file-to-internal-table-92b3d1f6d710

If nothing similar exists, I will create a function for this, or perhaps, if you are interested, a new method in the ZCL_EXCEL_READER_2007 class.

Regards.

entry.title: Reducing Weeks to Minutes: AI, ABAP, and Low-Code in SAP Development
entry.content:
Introduction

The creation of SAP applications has always required a combination of technical and functional knowledge. In many scenarios, ABAP developers need to master SAPUI5 to deliver modern, SAP Fiori-style applications that meet end-user expectations.

However, the integration of Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools with low-code platforms opens a new path: enabling ABAP developers to build complete applications without needing SAPUI5 knowledge, while still allowing continuous maintenance in a simple and secure way.

Tachyonix has developed an innovative approach that transforms business specifications into technical specifications through specialized AI tools, significantly accelerating the development process and drastically reducing delivery time.

Architecture

  • Flow with LLM

  • Flow with Tachyonix Builder

How ABAP Integration with AI Works

The flow begins with a specification provided by the user. For example: ‚ÄúI need a report that shows pending sales orders.‚Äù

From this request, different AI tools are triggered (these are some examples):

  • ABAP Package Tool: identifies the correct technical package where the application will be created.

  • Data Source Tool: selects the best source of data, indicating one or more relevant CDS Views.

  • Field Retrieval Tool: suggests the most appropriate fields to compose the application‚Äôs main list, based on the user‚Äôs description.

  • Floorplan Tool: recommends the visual structure of the application (for example, Master-Detail).

After these agents work together, a consolidated JSON containing the full technical specification is generated. This artifact is then used by the application creation agent:

  • Application Creation Tool: automatically builds the application according to the selected floorplan and the technical specifications provided by the other tools.

This flow allows complete applications to be created without manual programming, while still adhering to SAP best practices and design standards.

Integration with the Tachyonix Low-Code Platform

The main differentiator lies in the integration of this automation with the Tachyonix low-code platform. The generated application is not delivered as rigid, hard-to-maintain source code. On the contrary ‚Äî it remains fully editable and extensible, allowing ABAP developers to continue evolving the solution without dealing directly with SAPUI5 or JavaScript.

This approach differs from what is sometimes called vibe-coding, in which an LLM directly generates source code. In the Tachyonix model, the LLM does not generate code. Instead, it produces structured technical specifications, which are then processed by a creation agent. This design ensures:

  • Security and predictability of the result.

  • Ease of maintenance and customization.

  • No risks associated with unreadable or unsupportable generated code.

Practical Advantages

  • Speed: a process that could take weeks is reduced to minutes.

  • Productivity: developers spend only a few hours making final adjustments and personalizations.

  • Accessibility: even without SAPUI5 expertise, ABAP developers can deliver modern applications.

  • Flexibility: applications evolve continuously within the low-code platform, without technical barriers.

Knowledge Graph as AI Support

At the time of writing this article, SAP Joule does not yet provide a public API for external consumption. For this reason, Tachyonix developed its own Knowledge Graph, which brings together SAP business scenarios.

This repository is used as a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) mechanism, ensuring that the LLM always has access to reliable, contextual information throughout the process.

Conclusion

The combination of ABAP tools with a low-code platform represents a significant step forward for the ABAP community. This approach does not replace the developer ‚Äî it empowers them. With it, value can be delivered faster, more securely, and more sustainably, even without SAPUI5 knowledge.

In a market where time is a competitive advantage, solutions like Tachyonix reduce development cycles from weeks to minutes and establish a new paradigm for SAP application development.

As we are discussing AI, I leveraged HeyGen, an AI-based video creator, to demonstrate the process
Link: https://youtu.be/_VPU-Dps0sA
